TypeSignature.Value: public class DatagramSocket : Java.Lang.Object, IDisposable, Java.IO.ICloseable
.class public auto ansi beforefieldinit DatagramSocket extends Java.Lang.Object implements class Android.Runtime.IJavaObject, class Java.IO.ICloseable, class System.IDisposable

Docs.summary: This class implements a UDP socket for sending and receiving DatagramPacket.

remarks.para: This class implements a UDP socket for sending and receiving DatagramPacket. A DatagramSocket object can be used for both endpoints of a connection for a packet delivery service.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Constructs a UDP datagram socket which is bound to any available port on the local host using a wildcard address.

remarks.para: Constructs a UDP datagram socket which is bound to any available port on the local host using a wildcard address.

Docs.exception: if an error occurs while creating or binding the socket.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class Java.Net.DatagramSocketImpl socketImpl) cil managed

Docs.summary: Constructs a new DatagramSocket using the specific datagram socket implementation socketImpl.

remarks.para: Constructs a new DatagramSocket using the specific datagram socket implementation socketImpl. The created DatagramSocket will not be bound.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class Java.Net.SocketAddress localAddr) cil managed

Docs.summary: Constructs a new DatagramSocket bound to the host/port specified by the SocketAddresslocalAddr or an unbound DatagramSocket if the SocketAddress is null.

remarks.para: Constructs a new DatagramSocket bound to the host/port specified by the SocketAddresslocalAddr or an unbound DatagramSocket if the SocketAddress is null.

Docs.exception: if the SocketAddress is not supported
if a problem occurs creating or binding the socket.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(int32 aPort) cil managed

Docs.summary: Constructs a UDP datagram socket which is bound to the specific port aPort on the local host using a wildcard address.

remarks.para: Constructs a UDP datagram socket which is bound to the specific port aPort on the local host using a wildcard address. Valid values for aPort are between 0 and 65535 inclusive.

Docs.exception: if an error occurs while creating or binding the socket.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(int32 aPort, class Java.Net.InetAddress addr) cil managed

Docs.summary: Constructs a UDP datagram socket which is bound to the specific local address addr on port aPort.

remarks.para: Constructs a UDP datagram socket which is bound to the specific local address addr on port aPort. Valid values for aPort are between 0 and 65535 inclusive. If addr is null the socket will be bound to a wildcard address.

Docs.exception: if an error occurs while creating or binding the socket.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Bind(class Java.Net.SocketAddress localAddr) cil managed

Docs.param: the local machine address and port to bind on.
Docs.summary: Binds this socket to the local address and port specified by localAddr.

remarks.para: Binds this socket to the local address and port specified by localAddr. If this value is null any free port on a valid local address is used.

Docs.exception: if the SocketAddress is not supported
if the socket is already bound or a problem occurs during binding.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual bool Broadcast { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets the state of the socket option SocketOptions.SO_BROADCAST.

remarks.para:
Get method documentation [Android Documentation]
Gets the state of the socket option SocketOptions.SO_BROADCAST.

Set method documentation [Android Documentation]
Sets the socket option SocketOptions.SO_BROADCAST. This option must be enabled to send broadcast messages.

Docs.exception: if the socket is closed or the option is invalid.
if the socket is closed or the option could not be set.

Docs.summary: Returns this socket's DatagramChannel, if one exists.

remarks.para: Returns this socket's DatagramChannel, if one exists. A channel is available only if this socket wraps a channel. (That is, you can go from a channel to a socket and back again, but you can't go from an arbitrary socket to a channel.) In practice, this means that the socket must have been created by .

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Close() cil managed

Docs.summary: Closes this UDP datagram socket and all possibly associated channels.

remarks.para: Closes this UDP datagram socket and all possibly associated channels.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Connect(class Java.Net.SocketAddress peer) cil managed

Docs.summary: Connects this datagram socket to the address and port specified by peer.

remarks.para: Connects this datagram socket to the address and port specified by peer. Future calls to will use this as the default target, and will only accept packets from this source.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual void Connect (Java.Net.InetAddress address, int port);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Connect(class Java.Net.InetAddress address, int32 port) cil managed

Docs.summary: Connects this datagram socket to the specific address and port.

remarks.para: Connects this datagram socket to the specific address and port. Future calls to will use this as the default target, and will only accept packets from this source.
Beware: because it can't throw, this method silently ignores failures. Use instead.

Docs.summary: Disconnects this UDP datagram socket from the remote host.

remarks.para: Disconnects this UDP datagram socket from the remote host. This method called on an unconnected socket does nothing.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Receive(class Java.Net.DatagramPacket pack) cil managed

Docs.param: the DatagramPacket to store the received data.
Docs.summary: Receives a packet from this socket and stores it in the argument pack.

remarks.para: Receives a packet from this socket and stores it in the argument pack. All fields of pack must be set according to the data received. If the received data is longer than the packet buffer size it is truncated. This method blocks until a packet is received or a timeout has expired.

Docs.exception: if an error occurs while receiving the packet.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual bool ReuseAddress { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets the state of the socket option SocketOptions.SO_REUSEADDR.

remarks.para:
Get method documentation [Android Documentation]
Gets the state of the socket option SocketOptions.SO_REUSEADDR.

Set method documentation [Android Documentation]
Sets the socket option SocketOptions.SO_REUSEADDR. This option has to be enabled if more than one UDP socket wants to be bound to the same address. That could be needed for receiving multicast packets.
There is an undefined behavior if this option is set after the socket is already bound.

Docs.exception: if the socket is closed or the option is invalid.
if the socket is closed or the option could not be set.

remarks.para: Sends a packet over this socket.

Docs.exception: if an error occurs while sending the packet.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig void SetDatagramSocketImplFactory(class Java.Net.IDatagramSocketImplFactory fac) cil managed

Docs.summary: Sets the socket implementation factory.

remarks.para: Sets the socket implementation factory. This may only be invoked once over the lifetime of the application. This factory is used to create a new datagram socket implementation.

Docs.exception: if the factory has already been set.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual int SoTimeout { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets the socket .

remarks.para:
Get method documentation [Android Documentation]
Gets the socket .

Set method documentation [Android Documentation]
Sets the in milliseconds for this socket. This receive timeout defines the period the socket will block waiting to receive data before throwing an InterruptedIOException. The value 0 (default) is used to set an infinite timeout. To have effect this option must be set before the blocking method was called.

Docs.exception: if an error occurs while getting the option value.
if an error occurs while setting the option.

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which contains the java.lang.Class JNI value corresponding to this type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control which jclass is provided to methods like .

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which provides the declaring type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control virtual vs. non virtual method dispatch against the underlying JNI object. When this property is equal to the declaring type, then virtual method invocation against the JNI object is performed; otherwise, we assume that the method was overridden by a derived type, and perform non-virtual methdo invocation.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual int TrafficClass { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Returns this socket's setting.

remarks.para:

Returns this socket's setting.

Set method documentation [Android Documentation]

if the socket is closed or the option could not be set.
